title: Hardware requirements for option 2: SMA + SAM + UD/UCMDB
content:
If you plan to use deployment option 2 (SMA with SAM and Native SACM enabled), you need to determine the hardware resources required for both SMA and UD/UCMDB by following these two steps.

Step 1: Determine the hardware requirements for SMA

Determine the hardware requirements for the SMA and SAM capabilities, according to the SMA and SAM size definitions. The following table assumes both capabilities have the same size. If the two capabilities have different deployment sizes, see Hardware requirements for other options instead.

In this release, support for AlloyDB Omni is under controlled availability. Please contact our product management team before you begin the implementation in your production environment.

For details on installing and setting up PostgreSQL and AlloyDB Omni databases, see Prepare external databases.

For details on setting up AlloyDB Omni database for HA, see Prepare AlloyDB Omni for HA.

Step 2: Plan additional hardware resources for UCMDB

Plan the additional hardware resources required for UCMDB according to whether you will use a classic UCMDB or the containerized UCMDB. For details, see Additional hardware requirements for UD/UCMDB. 

  You can deploy SMA and UD/UCMDB in different deployment sizes. For SMA in large size, you can deploy UD/UCMDB in medium size.
